field_paragraph_text.value:
If you follow your plans accordingly, you were able to finish all your tasks. This practice is to simply help you have a good understanding of what you need to do within the limitations of time that you have. By prioritizing your tasks, you know what needs to be done before you can move on to other less important things.

Another good activity that you can try out is creating an action plan. The action plan helps you identify not only the tasks that you have to do, but also all the steps involved with a task and who is responsible for the tasks. This is especially helpful if you are working in a team of people. The action plan is divided by different goals that you set and then breaks it down to realistic action steps that you need to take to reach the goal. The accomplishment metric is just another way to say – how do you know when you have reached that goal? For example, your goal may be to identify all the potential foundations that you want to apply to for funding. How do you know when you have reached your goal? There are thousands of foundations that exist! You may state that your accomplishment metric is that when 25 foundations are found, you have reached your research goal. 

You can create action plans for all your goals, and then an easy way to track your progress, to help others know what they are responsible to do, and to see your progress.

Here’s an example:
